title: Get a State Pension forecast or statement

details.description: If you're approaching State Pension age you can get a statement of how much you'll receive (previously called a forecast)
details.body:
You can get an estimate of how much State Pension you may get by requesting a State Pension forecast or statement online, by phone or by post.

Use the State Pension calculator to get an instant estimate of how much basic State Pension you may get and the earliest you may get it.

You can get a full estimate of your State Pension by requesting a State Pension forecast or statement. The process depends on when you reach State Pension age.

You reach State Pension age before 6 April 2016

You can get a State Pension forecast online, by phone or in the post.

Get a forecast online

You can only get a forecast online if:

  • you live in the UK
  • you’re more than 4 months away from State Pension age

If you’re a woman over 60, you have to register every time you use the online service.

By phone or by post

You can get a forecast up to 30 days before you reach State Pension age. You’ll usually receive it in the post within 10 working days.

Call the Future Pension Centre or complete the application form and post it to the address on the form.

Download ‘State Pension forecast application form’ (PDF, 317KB)

You reach State Pension age on or after 6 April 2016

You can get a State Pension statement by phone or by post, usually within 10 working days. You can’t get a statement online.

By phone or by post

You can get a statement up to 30 days before you reach State Pension age. You’ll usually receive it in the post within 10 working days.

Call the Future Pension Centre or complete the application form and post it to the address on the form.

Download ‘State Pension statement application form’ (PDF, 317KB)

You’re over State Pension age or less than 30 days away from it

You can still get an estimate of your State Pension by calling the Pension Service.

The Pension Service
Telephone: 08456 060 265
Textphone: 0800 731 7339
Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm

Call the International Pension Centre if you live outside the UK.

International Pension Centre
Telephone: +44 (0)191 218 7777
Textphone: +44 (0)191 218 7280
Monday to Friday, 8am to 8pm

There is a leaflet to help you understand your pension statement
